required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chimeric Antigen Receptor T-cell and Cellular Therapies for the Treatment of cAncer or BLood Diseases: Evaluation of Reporting of Adverse Events
clinical_study.official_title: Chimeric Antigen Receptor T-cell and Cellular Therapies for the Treatment of cAncer or BLood Diseases: Evaluation of Reporting of Adverse Events

brief_summary.textblock: CAR-T cells and cellular therapies may lead to various adverse reactions. This study investigates reports of different toxicities for cellular therapies in the World Health Organization's (WHO) global database of individual safety case reports (VigiBase).

detailed_description.textblock: CAR-T cells and cellular therapies are responsible of a wide range of side effects.The investigators use VigiBase, the World Health Organization (WHO) database of individual safety case reports, to identify cases of adverse drug reactions following treatment with cellular therapies

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events with significant over-reporting CAR-T cells and other cellular therapies
primary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) of individual safety case reports to January 2020
primary_outcome.description: Identification and report of various toxicities of cellular therapies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Causality assessment of reported adverse events according to the WHO system
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) of individual safety case reports to January 2020

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the type of adverse event depending on the class and the target of cellular therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) of individual safety case reports to January 2020

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the duration of treatment when the toxicity happens and the time to onset
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) of individual safety case reports to January 2020

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the drug-drug interactions associated with adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) of individual safety case reports to January 2020

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the pathologies (cancer) for which the incriminated drugs have been prescribed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) of individual safety case reports to January 2020

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the population of patients having an adverse event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) of individual safety case reports to January 2020

arm_group.description: Cases reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) and the French pharmacovigilance database of patients treated by Chimeric Antigen Receptor T-cell and Cellular Therapies, with a chronology compatible with the drug toxicity

intervention.description: Chimeric Antigen Receptor T-cell and Cellular Therapies for the treatment of a cancer either solid or hematologic malignancy

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated with cellular therapy for solid or hematologic cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) database of individual safety case reports to 01/01/2020
- Adverse events reported were including any MedDRA terms
- Patients treated with cellular therapies reported in the WHO database.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronology not compatible between the drug and the toxicity

condition_browse.mesh_term: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions
